Pre-Game Insights: England will face Greece in a highly anticipated Nations League encounter at Wembley this Thursday, marking their first meeting in 18 years.
Interim manager Lee Carsley sees this match as another opportunity to prove his credentials.
Both sides have secured victories over Ireland and Finland in their opening matches, but Greece edges out England on goal difference.
Historically, England have dominated Greece, remaining undefeated in nine previous encounters, winning seven and drawing two.
The most memorable match between these nations dates back 23 years to David Beckham’s iconic last-minute free kick that sealed England’s spot in the 2002 World Cup.
Captain Harry Kane is set to lead the line after overcoming an injury scare while on duty with Bayern Munich.
Injuries have forced Ezri Konsa, Kobbie Mainoo, and Morgan Gibbs-White to withdraw from the squad.
Dominic Solanke has been called up for the first time in seven years.
Phil Foden, Jude Bellingham, and Kyle Walker are expected to feature.
Greece have a full-strength squad, with West Ham’s Dinos Mavropanos and Liverpool’s Kostas Tsimikas likely to start.
Despite being ranked 48th by FIFA, the Greek side will look to challenge England with a disciplined defensive approach.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be broadcast live in the UK on ITV1, with live streaming available via the ITVX app.
